4046240.name: Ios Mylopotas Analipsi Mersina
4046240.description: about 2.5 hrs round hike along ridge and rock coast passing three historic chapels, nice view of Mylopotas bay, trail partially in difficult terrain, take enough water and sun protection

4049119.name: Ios Chora Skarkos archeological park
4049119.description: hike on island Ios Cyclades Aegean, about 45 min one way, easy hike from Chora down to Skarkos archeological park

4049120.name: Ios Mylopotas Manganari (Ridge Trail)
4049120.description: island Ios Cyclades Aegean, about 4.5 hours backcountry hike, partially poor trail visibility and difficult terrain, only few spots at Kefala ridge marked by blue stripe and stone figures, take enough water and sun protection, no shops in Manganari

4052075.name: Εθνικό μονοπάτι O4

4056457.name: Ios Chora Profiti Ilias

4056458.name: Ios Chora Pyrgos (via Agios Ioannis Prodromos)

4069857.name: Ios Κάλαμος Psathi (Coast Range Trail)

4069858.name: Ios Psathi Agio Theodoti (Paleokastro Trail)

4071145.description: island Ios Cyclades Aegean, 4 day backcountry hiking circuit via Manganari, Psathi Agio Theodoti, partially poor trail visibility and difficult terrain, take enough water and sun protection, no shops, no hotel or rooms in Kalamos

14781255.name: 12/1 - Κόρωνος – Σταυρός – Κεραμωτή – Ρουτσούνα – Σωτήρα – Σκεπόνι
14781255.symbol: red bar on left, white bar on right with number 12/1
14781255.int_name: 12/1 - Koronos – Stauros – Keramoti – Routsouna – Sotira – Skeponi

14781272.name: 12/2 - Σκεπόνι – Ξεστράτισμα – Βίγλες – Μονοδέντρι – Αλακόπετρα – Κωμιακή
14781272.symbol: red bar on left, white bar on right with number 12/2
14781272.int_name: 12/2 - Skeponi – Xestratisma – Vigles – Monodentri – Alakopetra – Komiaki

14781280.name: 12/A - Σίφωνες – Λειβάδα – Καδή – Κεραμωτή
14781280.symbol: red bar on left, white bar on right with number 12/A

14781301.name: 13 - Απεράθου – Άγ. Γεώργιος & Παχώμιος – Σταυρός/Άγ. Ερμόλαος Κακαβά – Λάκκους – Μερσίνι – Άγ. Ιωάννης Θεολόγος στα Γράμματα – Δανακός
14781301.symbol: red bar on left, white bar on right with number 13
14781301.int_name: 13 - Aperathou – Agios Georgios & Pachomios – Stauros/Agios Ermolaos Kakava – Lakkous – Mersini – Agios Ioannis Theologos Grammata – Danakos

14782008.name: 13/A - Απεράθου – Προβολάκια – Πηγή Φλέα
14782008.symbol: red bar on left, white bar on right with number 13/A

14782244.name: 15 - Πάνερμος – Άντρ(ι)ους – Σπεδό – Ρίνα – Καλαντός
14782244.symbol: red bar on left, white bar on right with number 15

14782547.name: 16 - Τραγαία (Χαλκί) – Άγιος Γεώργιος – Δαμαριώνας – Πηγή Μερσινού – Παναγία στη Σπηλιά – Ξερόκαμπος – Κάστρο Απαλύρου
14782547.symbol: red bar on left, white bar on right with number 16
14782547.int_name: 16 - Tragaia (Chalki) – Agios Georgios – Damarionas – Pigi Mersinou – Panagia sti Spilia – Xerokampos – Kastro Apalyrou

14782792.name: 17 - Τρίποδες (Βίβλος) – Πύργος Αγίου Γεωργίου – Άγ. Θεόδωροι – Άγ. Νικόλαος στα Ρινίδια – Άγιος Ματθαίος – Ακτή Πλάκας
14782792.symbol: red bar on left, white bar on right with number 17
14782792.int_name: 17 - Tripodes (Vivlos) – Pyrgos Agiou Georgiou – Agioi Theodoroi – Agios Nikolaos Rinidia – Agios Matthaios – Akti Plakas

14784780.name: 1 - Άγιος Ανδρέας - Αρτεμώνας
14784780.description: This hiking route takes you through the history of Sifnos, passing by places of great importance for sequential historical periods

14784821.name: 2 - Κάστρο - Παναγία Χρυσοπηγή
14784821.description: Towards the Miraculous Saint - This route will take the hiker from the old capital city of Kastro to the most important monastery of Sifnos through historic trails with great views while passing two beautiful beaches along the way.

14784858.name: 3 - Απολλωνία - Πλατύς Γυαλός
14784858.description: The Agricultural Road - This route will guide the hiker from Apollonia to the wide beach of Platys Gyalos through terraced fields with their irrigation channels and places of religious interest.

14784897.name: 3A - Θόλος - Παναγία Χρυσοπηγή
14784897.description: This trail gives the hiker of Sifnos Trail 03 the opportunity to visit the church of Panagia Chrysopigi and the beach of Apokofto.

14784919.name: 4 - Πλατύς Γιαλός - Φυκιάδα - Πλατύς Γιαλός
14784919.description: Cedars, Olive Trees and the Sea - This circular route takes hikers from Platys Gialos to the balcony of Profitis Ilias Kondou chappel and down to the beautiful bay of Fykiada before closing the circle back at Platys Gialos

14784949.name: 4A - Βαθύ - Πύργος Μεγαλογιάννη
14784949.description: Trail 4A is an alternative start of trail 4 linking trail 4 to Vathy bay, and to the trailhead of trail 5.

14785035.name: 5 - Απολλωνία - Παναγία του Νήλιου - Βαθύ
14785035.description: The Hidden Sides of Sifnos - This route takes the hiker from Apollonia to the beach of Vathy, performing an almost complete traverse from the eastern part of the island to the western coast, through the always interesting backcountry of Sifnos.

14785079.name: 5A - Βουγνού - Αϊ Νικόλας τα Αερινά - Φρούδια Μπαρώνας
14785079.int_name: 5A - Vougnou - Agios Nikolas Aerina - Froudia Baronas
14785079.description: This trail is an alternative to Trail 5 a little before the finish at Vathy, giving the hiker the option of a higher pass through Mavro Chorio and Aerina before rejoining the main trail.

14785123.name: 6 - Απολλωνία - Παναγία Τόσο Νερό - Απολλωνία
14785123.description: Sifnos Insiders - This circular route is the longest of Sifnos, taking hikers from Apollonia to all of the central mainland sites of the island.

14785208.name: 6A - Καμάρες - Κάψαλος
14785208.description: This difficult uphill trail takes from Kamares to the track of trail 6.

14785279.name: 6B - Φυρόγια - Προφήτης Ηλίας
14785279.description: Trail 6B takes the hikers from Firogia to the highest summit of Sifnos, where the Monastery of Profitis Ilias is.

14785380.name: 7 - Αρτεμώνας - Άγιος Συμεών
14785380.description: The Pilgrimage Route - This trail takes the hikers from Artemonas to Agios Symeno through the still cultivated backcountry of Sifnos.

14785408.name: 7A - Απολλωνία - Καλαμπελάς
14785408.description: This trail serves as an alternative start for trail 7, taking the hikers from Apollonia to Kalabelas.

14785466.name: 8 - Αρτεμώνας - Άγιος Σώστης
14785466.description: The Route of the Mines - This trail takes the hikers from Artemonas to the ancient mines in the northeast of Sifnos.

14785474.name: 9 - Καμπαναριό - Χερρόνησος
14785474.description: The Wuthering North - This route guides the hiker through the northern backcountry of Sifnos from Kambanario to Cherronissos.

14785530.name: 9A - Αμπουρδέκτης - Άγιος Φίλιππος / Άι Νικόλας
14785530.description: Trail 9A connects Ambourdektis, along trail 9, to the church of Agios Filippos / Agios Nikolaos.

14785596.name: 10 - Απολλωνία - Καμάρες
14785596.description: The Cursed Trail - Walk the donkey route that connected Apollonia with Kamares, passing by the church of Panagia Platanissa.

14785648.name: 10A - Καλαμπελάς - Παναγία Πλατάνισσα
14785648.description: Trail 10A is an alternative route to the first part of trail 10, linking Kamares to Kalambelas, and from there to Artemonas (through trail 7) or Apollonia (trail 7A).

14785664.name: 5A connection
14785664.description: If you want to go along path 5 both ways, you can use alternative 5A to not retrace exactly the same itinerary on the way back.

14864821.name: Φα - Λιθί
14864821.description: The Fa area is hot served by public transport. The length of the trail and the steep ground may be tiring in summertime. Beginning from Fa, the starting point for the hike is on the asphalt road from Agios Giorgios Sikoussis to Avgonima.

14864844.name: Ολύμποι - Μεστά
14864844.description: Natural environment: Groves of olive trees and mastic trees, shrubby vegetation and forest higher up, along with old step-terraced fields on the hillsides.

14864978.name: Άγιοι Πατέρες - Νέα Μονή
14864978.description: The trail starts from the monastery of Agioi Pateres. After walking on the asphalt paved road for about 200 m, it reach the entrance to the footpath, where there is an informational sign.

14865018.name: Φαράγγι Καμπιών
14865018.description: The hiking trail runs down towards the river, walking along the riverbed

14865217.name: Βολισσός - Κοιλάδα Μαλαγκιώτη - Παναγία Νερομύλων - Βολισσός
14865217.int_name: Volissos - Malagkiotis Valley - Panagia Neromylon - Volissos
14865217.description: An easy walk through the plain of Volissos. Circular trail

14865310.name: Άγ. Γιάννης - Άγ. Γάλας
14865310.description: This hiking trail links the village of Agio Galas with the settlement of Agios Giannis, which has been abandoned since around 1960. It includes important monuments of the island’s cultural heritage and natural environment.

15826446.name: Kakoperato - Zastano peak - Vigla peak - Monument

15826911.name: Karlovasi - Paleo Karlovasi - Aghios Antonios cave - Potami

15828126.name: Aghia Zoni - Profitis Elias - Aghia Zoni

15850567.name: Skamneli Stani Katsanu Isadi tis Mygas Konitsa Trail

15851425.name: Vythos Skotomeno Nero Voio Profitis Ilias Trail

15854113.name: Aetomilitsa Pano Arena Kato Arena Chrysi Trail

15854150.name: Moutsalia Limni Pano Arena Mt.Kanellopoulos Trail

15863701.name: Agia Anastasia Belos Tomaros Prof Ilias Trail

15871038.name: Meteora Trail M 01 - Doupiani – Ypapanti
15871038.description: This trail runs on the west side of the Meteora Rocks, towards the furthest of them, that of Ypapanti Monastery, under the shade of the rocks, between oak tree forests and pleasant meadows.

15871068.name: Meteora Trail M02 - Ypapanti – Varlaam Trail
15871068.description: This quick acces from the monastery of Ypapanti to the monastery of Varlaam has some interesting viewpoints to offer to the hikers.

15871081.name: Meteora Trail M03 - Ypapanti – Tsouma Diakopia Peak Trail
15871081.description: This route takes the hikers form Ipapanti monastery to a peak to the north of the Meteora complex with panoramic views over the region, through a dense oak forest.

15871091.name: Meteora Trail M04 - Tsouma Diakopia Peak – Varlaam Monastery Trail
15871091.description: This route connects the highest peak of the network with a rocky outcrop that serves as a tourist attraction because of the views one can get from it.

15871117.name: Meteora Trail M05 -Tsouma Diakopia Peak – Meteora Observation Deck Trail
15871117.description: This route connects the highest peak of the network with a rocky outcrop that serves as a tourist attraction because of the views one can get from it.

15871240.name: Meteora Trail M06 - Kalampaka Byzantine Church – Holy Trinity Monastery Trail
15871240.description: This trail connects the settlement of Kalabaka with the Monastery of Agia Triada following the route that connected these two points for hundreds of years.

15871282.name: Meteora Trail M07 - Holy Trinity - Kalampaka Highschool Trail
15871282.description: This scenic trail takes hikers from the heights of the Monasteries of Agia Triada and Agios Stefanos down to the town of kalambaka through a beautiful cobblestone trail shaded by big oak trees which then leads to dirt and asphalt roads.

15871294.name: Meteora Trail M08 - Kastraki old Aqueduct – Monastery of Roussanou Trail
15871294.description: This route runs among some impressive rocks, with great views, under the canopy of deciduous trees, keeping the inhabited ones on one side and the currently uninhabited on the other.

15871457.name: Meteora Trail M09 - Fairy Fountain – Kastraki Old Aqueduct Trail
15871457.description: This route takes hikers from Kastraki to the old water supply of the settlement, passing under Agio Pnevma rock and through a scenic forest trail.

15871476.name: Meteora Trail M10 - Small Walls – Holy Trinity Trail
15871476.description: This is a short downhill trail among some smaller rocks which connects the asphalt road U turn at Monastery of Roussanou with the trail of Agia Triada and subsequently Kalambaka.

15871629.name: Meteora Trail M11 - Small Walls – Meteora Observation Deck Trail
15871629.description: This shortest route of the network connects the most popular viewpoint of Meteora with trail M10 and subsequently with Kalambaka.

15871665.name: Meteora Trail M12 - Kalampaka Byzantine Church – Meteora Digital Projection Center Trail
15871665.description: This short route on the edge of Kalampaka takes hikers from one edge of the settlement to the other while giving acces to some daring ascents and viewpoints.

15871715.name: Meteora Trail M13 - Varlaam Monastery – Kastraki Old Aqueduct Trail
15871715.description: This route takes hikers from the Monastery of Varlaam towards the settlement of Kastraki, through the old cobblestone trail that once supplied this monastery as well as that of Megalo Meteoro.

15871741.name: Meteora Trail M14 - Meteora Digital Projection Center – Fairy Fountain
15871741.description: This route connects the settlement of Kalambaka with that of Kastraki through roads with little traffic and then through a trail that connects the hermitage of Badovas with Kastraki.

15871826.name: Meteora Trail O 01 - Tsouma Diakopia Peak - Tzertzi - Agios Stefanos Monastery
15871826.description: This trail starts from the highest peak of the network and descends towards the Monastery of Agios Stefanos and Kalambaka, keeping the whole of Meteora to the west. Across the route comes the picturesque church of Agios Athanasios at Tzertzi

15873962.name: Meteora Trail O 03 - Lianomodia Couloir
15873962.description: This short route which can act as an appendix of route M08 guides hikers via an easy mountain couloir to a magnificent viepoint.

15874004.name: Ίος Μαγγανάρι Κάλαμος μονοπάτι
15874004.note: the path is marked with red bars and stone towers/collections at some points
15874004.description: traditional footway connecting Manganari and Kalamos via Tris Ekklisies and Papas bays, about 1.5 hours, take enough water and sun protection

15875536.name: Meteora Trail O 04 - Approaching Ypapanti Rock
15875536.description: This short addition to route M04 gives acces from the Monastery of Ypapanti to the rear of the Monastery's Rock and to some interesting viewpoints towards the rest of Meteora.

15875605.name: Meteora Trail O 05 - Circular branch of M02
15875605.description: This circular route is meant to enrich the experience of M02 route with some awesome viewpoints.

15875621.name: Meteora Trail O 06 - Approaching Megalo Meteoro Monastery from route M13
15875621.description: This quick route gives an alternate start or finish to route M13, towards Megalo Meteoro monastery isntead of Varlaam.

15875653.name: Meteora Trail O 07 - By the side of Doupiani Rock
15875653.description: Take a close look at Doupiani Rock and its centuries old buildings, through this short route.

15875856.name: Meteora Trail O 09 - To Agio Pnevma Rock
15875856.description: This short route, which could be a detour of route M09, takes hikers higher on the Rock of Agio Pnevma to a plateau of great views and serenity.

15876635.name: Santorini Trail 01 - Pyrgos - Prophet Elias Monastery - Ancient Thera
15876635.description: Hike from the settlement of Pyrgos to Ancient Thira across the ridge of Profitis Ilias on this linear route.

15876689.name: Santorini Trail 02 - Mesa Gonia - Pyrgos - Emporio
15876689.description: This route ascends from Mesa Gonia to Pyrgos and descends towards Emporio to give the hiker beautiful views of the agricultural land that surrounds these settlements and great sights of the historic core and the traditional archtecture inside them.

15876860.name: Santorini Trail 03 - Perissa - Ancient Thera - Kamari
15876860.description: This hike connects the settlements of Perissa and Kamari through the mountain pass of Sellada and brings the hikers through some interesting archaeological and religious sites.

15876881.name: Santorini Trail 04 - Panagia Episkopis - Pyrgos
15876881.description: From the Byzantine Church of Panagia Episkopis to the picturesque chapel of Agios Georgios to Katefio and till the settlement of Pyrgos this route offers beautiful views of the countryside of Santorini among some major cultural sights of the island

15876986.name: Santorini Trail 05 - Pyrgos - Ekso Gonia - Mesa Gonia
15876986.description: From the historic settlement of Pyrgos this route takes the hikers down the eastern slopes of the extended Profitis Ilias massif towards Panagia Episkopis, with beautiful views, passing mostly traditional urban landscapes.

15877025.name: Santorini Trail 06 - Megalochori - Pyrgos
15877025.description: This hike connects two very interesting traditional settlements of Santorini with a short length, while offering the chance for an urban exploration of Megalochori and Pyrgos.

15877107.name: Santorini Trail 07 - Megalochori - Plaka
15877107.description: This short route takes the hikers from Megalochori to the \"Heart of Santorini\" and down to the sea level, where encircled by the walls of the caldera lie the abandoned thermal baths of Plaka.

15877154.name: Santorini Trail 09 - The Ledge of the Caldera
15877154.description: Walking across the Ledge of the Caldera, this most popular route of Santorini will offer hikers a taste of the geology of this island along with a continuous shopping promenade in one cosmopolitan location probably filled with walkers.

15877255.name: Santorini Trail 10 - Finikia - Kolumbos
15877255.description: This downhill route takes hikers from the ledge of the Caldera, down to the eastern coastline of Santorini, close to the underwater volcano of Kolumbos, through a beautful traditonal settlement and abandoned agrcultural land.

15877300.name: Santorini Trail 11 - Akrotiri - Ormos Mpalou
15877300.description: This circular route takes the hikers from the settlement of Akrotiri to the impressive coastline of Apothiki and back to the start

15877394.name: Santorini Trail 12 - Akrotiri - Faros
15877394.description: Starting from the settlement of Akrotiri this route takes the hikers through some unique coastal landscapes and seaside cliffs before reaching the lighthouse of Akrotiri at the edge of the cape.

15877452.name: Santorini Trail 13 - Akrotiri - Vlichada beach
15877452.description: This route takes hikers from the settlement of Akrotiri to the impressive Vlichada beach through vine fields and dirt roads.

15877522.name: Santorini Trail AN - Agios Antonios side route
15877522.description: Take a quick detour from route 9 to visit a picturesque church viewing the Caldera with a resting cave right next to it.

15877553.name: Santorini Trail DI - Viewpoint Diapla
15877553.description: Take this very short route to reach a special viewpoint above the settlement of Emporio.

15877558.name: Santorini Trail GY - Fira - Mesa Gyalos
15877558.description: Take this walk down to the old port of Fira on the inside of the Caldera and if you don't feel like climbing back up take the cable car.

15877609.name: Santorini Trail SK - Imerovigli - Skaros
15877609.description: Take this route to see the rock of Skaros and the ruined castle from up close and to visit the two churches as well as the antiquities that lie in the vicinity.

15879856.name: Corfu Paths CC02 - Stavros Loop Hike

15879926.name: Corfu Paths CC04
15879926.description: Olive Groves and the Stone Forest

15879934.name: Corfu Paths CC05
15879934.description: From the Village to the Monastery

15880166.name: waymarks cairns
15880166.note: the path is marked with stone towers/collections at some points
15880166.description: traditional footway connecting Manganari and Kalamos via Tris Ekklisies

15880167.name: waymarks red bar
15880167.note: the path is marked with red bars
15880167.description: traditional footway connecting Manganari and Kalamos via Tris Ekklisies

15882340.via: Profitis Ilias Monastery – (Eros Peak) – Episkopi – Palamidas – Vlychos
15882340.name: 1 - Western Hydra
15882340.description: Western Hydra - This trail circles the west part of Hydra, approaching monasteries, settlements and archaeological findings, as well as the highest peak of the island with panoramic views all along.

15882416.name: 3 - Hydra (Town) – Zourva Monastery – Zourva Lighthouse
15882416.description: Eastern Hydra - This route connects the town of Hydra with the Lighthouse of Zourva in the easternmost edge of the island, through trails that cross fields, churches and farmhouses.

15882559.name: 4 - Hydra (Town) – Mandraki – Hydra (Town)
15882559.description: The Heroic Harbour - Trail 4 is essentially a short circular hike and starts from the port of Hydra

15882817.name: Ithaca Trail 01B
15882817.description: To Anemodouri – Arethousa Spring and Pigadi Beach - Take this detour of route 01 to see the infamous Arethousa Krini under the majestic \"Korakos Petra\" rock.

15882904.name: Ithaca Trail 12
15882904.description: Travel in Time - This one of the most popular hiking routes of Ithaca. It connects the mountainous Anogi with the seaside Kioni, a village which was founded by the inhabitants of Anogi in the early 1800s, when the threat of pirates had diminished

15883402.name: Santorini Trail 08 - Pyrgos - Vothonas (closed for now)
15883402.note: Do not attempt this route for the time being as it is currently impassable for the bigger part due to overgrown vegetation and abandonment.
15883402.description: This short (but currently impassable) route takes the hikers on a downhil trail from Pyrgos to Vothonas connecting two beautiful settlements

15883498.name: Kassos Trail 1
15883498.description: The settlements of Kassos - This circular route connects all the settlements of the sland through old trails between abandoned and cultivated fields.

15883505.name: Kassos Trail 1A
15883505.description: This route is an alternative course of Kassos Trail 1 with the aim of shortening the total length of the latter. It moves along an old path which connected Arvanitochori with Fri, following a stream.

15883522.name: Kassos Trail 2
15883522.description: The Geological Route - This circular route connects Arvanitochori with the unique cave of Stylokamara and the chapel of Profitis Ilias placed on a spot with panoramic views.

15883575.name: Kassos Trail 3
15883575.description: Old Agricultural Landscapes - This circular route takes the hikers form Arvantochori to the heights in the SE of Kassos with amazing views and back to the start via the settlement of Poli

15883617.name: Kassos Trail 4
15883617.description: The Peak of Kassos - This is the summit route of Kassos bringing hikers from the plateau of Skafi to the peak of Megalos Prionas.

15883631.name: Kassos Trail 5
15883631.description: The Ancient Greek Writings - Walk by the eastern ridge of Kassos in this route to find the viewpoint towards Karpathos, where Ellinika Grammata - the ancient greek scribings - are found.

15884233.name: Kassos Trail 6
15884233.description: Wild Kassos - This long route takes the hikers from Agios Georgios, Hadies to Agia Marina settlement, offering detours towards a beautiful beach and a unique cave which has protected antiquities from many historical periods.

15884429.name: Kassos Trail 6A
15884429.description: Kassos Trail 6a is an alternative that complements route Kassos Trail 6 so that a part of it can be walked in a circular way.

15884460.name: Kassos Trail 7
15884460.description: Trail 7 is a pedestrian approach to Avlaki beach, which was until recently inaccessible by road.

15885087.name: Skiathos Trail 03
15885087.description: Lake and Sea - This is an easy, circular route solely on asphalt road, with a beautiful view of the wetland of Agios Georgios.

15885100.name: Skiathos Trail 03A
15885100.description: Lake and Sea - This small route, branching out from ST3, gives access to a beautiful church and a view point bringing hikers on a walk almost by the sea.

15885182.name: Skiathos Trail 04
15885182.description: The Olive Trees Trail - As the name suggests this route moves mainly through olive groves in a circular pattern from Chorio to the north and back.

15885219.name: Skiathos Trail 04A
15885219.description: The Olive Trees Trail - This route is a branch of Route 4 and leads to the beach Megas Gialos. It’s a detour that allows hikers to get to this beach of wild beauty, which is only accesible by foot

15885244.name: Skiathos Trail 05
15885244.description: The Roads of the Monastery - This trail connects the capital of Skiathos with the monastery of Evangelistria, giving acces to the rest of the network, either towards Kastro or towards the North-West part of the island.

15885311.name: Skiathos Trail 06
15885311.description: The Roads of the Castle- This route has a little bit of everything Skiathos has to offer - cultutral sites, natural beauty - everything except civilization.

15885811.name: Skiathos Trail 07
15885811.description: Walking on the Peaks - Take this route to hike between Skiathos's peaks with panoramic views.

15885878.name: Skiathos Trail 08
15885878.description: Faith and Antiquities - This route combines some of the most interesting cultural sites of Skiathos, such as Pyrgi, Kastro and a number of picturesque chappels in a circular trail under the lush vegetation of the island

15885955.name: Skiathos Trail 09
15885955.description: Following the Water - The creek of Kechria and the creek of Acheelas compose this route which expands from the Monastery of Kechria, down to the beaches of Kechria and Lygaries.

15886091.name: Skiathos Trail 09A
15886091.description: Following the Water - This trail, branching from route 09, connects Megali Ammos Beach and the capital in the south with Kechria Monastery and Kechria beach in the north.

15887071.name: Skiathos Trail 10
15887071.description: Water and Wind - This route connects the peak of Elatos with the creek of Acheelas, mixing great views with lush vegetation.

15887151.name: Skiathos Trail 12
15887151.description: Kalamaki Loop Trail - This is a circular route that passes by the beaches and viewpoints of Kanapitsa mostly on dirt roads and it is ideal for jogging.

15887197.name: Skiathos Trail 13
15887197.description: Mountain and Sea - This route connects the beaches of Mikros Aselinos and Megalos Aselinos with some picturesque churches hidden in the pine forest of the NW part of Skiathos

15887244.name: Skiathos Trail 14
15887244.description: Forest and Sea - This route takes hikers on a tour of the northwestern beaches of Skiathos through pine forests, schrublands and coastlines.

15887265.name: Skiathos Trail 15
15887265.description: Freshwater and Seawater - This route offers a pleasant and very mild hiking experience around the wetland of Strofilia next to its unique seaside pine forest.

15896724.name: 1Α - Άγιος Ανδρέας - Φηρώγια
15896724.description: A trail connecting the arhaeological site of Agios Andreas with Firogia through fields filled with archaeological findings.

15905017.name: Meteora Trail O02 - Kalampaka - Badovas Heremitages
15905017.description: This steep route which is meant only for experienced mountain hikers takes through a couloir from Κalambaka to the Hermitage of Agios Nikolaos of Badovas.

15905563.from: Church of Koimisi tis Theotokou (Trani Ekklissia)
15905563.name: Meteora Trail O08 - To Adrachti Rock
15905563.description: This route guides hikers to the the imposing rock of Adrachti and to some interesting viewpoints in the vicinity.

15938095.name: Hydra Trail 1A
15938095.description: This small route gives hikers of Trail 1 the oportunity to move further west across the islandish landscapes and reach Bisti beach.

15948542.name: Ithaca Trail 01
15948542.description: Guided by Homer's Verses - Take this route to visit the Plateau of Marathias and its unique sights, starting from Perachori.

15948571.name: Ithaca Trails 01A
15948571.description: Take this panoptic trail to descend from the Plateau of Marathias to Perachori

15948597.name: Ithaca Trail 03
15948597.description: Walking through History - This trail takes hikers form the port of Vathy to the medieval capital of Paleochora through a winding trail that crosses abandoned fields and remnants of agricultural land uses.

15948682.name: Ithaca Trail 03A
15948682.description: This trail offers an alternative return route for trail 03, circling back to Vathy through old trails and places interlaced with the stories of the elders.

15948712.name: Ithaca Trail 05
15948712.description: Strolling by the Sea - This walk by the sea, starts at Vathy and reaches the abandoned lighthouse of Agios Andreas, near the picturesque church of the same name

15948727.name: Ithaca Trail 11
15948727.description: Mountain Path on the \"Distinguished Nirito\" - This path connects the Monastery of Katharon with Anogi and Exogi, passing by the mountainous terrain of Niritis, the highest mountain of Ithaca.

15948743.name: Ithaca Trail 012A
15948743.description: This uphill trail could be the return trip for trail 12, taking hikers from Kioni to Anogi throught the smooth landscape of Vigla.

15948772.name: Ithaca Trail 13
15948772.description: Ascending to the Sunset - This route takes hikers from the port town of Frikes, up the stream of the same name, to reach the church of Panagia tis Skalas form where one could attend an unforgettable sunset.

15948788.name: Ithaca Trail 14
15948788.description: The Archaeological Walk of Northern Ithaca -

15948818.name: Ithaca Trail 14A
15948818.description: This trail can be used as a return route for the hikers of route 14, and connects abandoned agricultural landscapes through mountain slopes and ravines, offering awesome views along the way.

15948872.name: Ithaca Trail 14B
15948872.description: This trail takes hikers from Exogi to the edge of Roussanos platueau, through abandoned agricultural land and forestal slopes wiht great views
